intro: Tithymalus × bazargicus, commonly known as the hybrid tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant is native to regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing a delicate, aromatic fragrance. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed in horticulture.
